markings: artist's seal: 能鳥 {Kumadori} | publisher's seal: 版元東京銀座渡辺木版画舗 {Hanmoto Tōkyō Ginza Watanabe mokuhan gaho}
medium: Woodblock print, ink and color on paper with embossing
portfolio: Eighteen Kabuki Makeups (Kumadori jūhachiban 隈取十八番)
text: It is unclear when this so-called crab makeup was developed. The role depicted seems to be that of Anewa Heiji 姉輪平次 for which the actor Bandō Mitsugorō VII (1882-1961) used this makeup in the play The Town of Suma: Rhododendrons of the Genpei (Suma no miyako Genpei tsutsuji 須磨都源平躅躑), performed at the Ichimura Theater in June of 1914.
title: Crab Makeup
